content: <!-- RSS generated by The Office of Senator Christopher Coons on {ts '2015-03-04 14:56:28'} --> <rss version="2.0"> <channel> <title>Senator Christopher Coons' News Feed</title> <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/rss/feeds/</link> <description>Feed from the website of Senator Christopher Coons</description> <language>en-us</language> <copyright>Copyright 2015</copyright> <docs>http://www.coons.senate.gov/rss/feeds/</docs> <lastBuildDate>Wed, 04 Mar 2015 14:56:28 EST</lastBuildDate> <ttl>1</ttl> <skipDays>   <day>Saturday</day>   <day>Sunday</day> </skipDays> <skipHours>   <hour>1</hour>   <hour>2</hour>   <hour>3</hour>   <hour>4</hour>   <hour>5</hour> </skipHours>              <item>    <title>An education solution that's plain to see</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/an-education-solution-thats-plain-to-see</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Fri, 24 Oct 2014 11:24:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>It's hard to learn when you can't read the chalkboard. Yet for more than 6,000 of Delaware's students, the biggest challenge they face isn't just solving a math problem, but also seeing it. The good news is we have a path forward. The organization Vision To Learn found that one of the best ways t...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/an-education-solution-thats-plain-to-see</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>U.S. business shouldn't miss 'the next China'</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/us-business-shouldnt-miss-the-next-china</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Sun, 03 Aug 2014 10:46:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Washington's relentless focus on crisis tends to cloud its ability to see great opportunities. With more than 40 African heads of state coming to Washington this week for three days of meetings with President Barack Obama, Cabinet officials, members of Congress and American business...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/us-business-shouldnt-miss-the-next-china</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Congress must stand up for victims of child abuse</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/congress-must-stand-up-for-victims-of-child-abuse</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Sat, 21 Jun 2014 12:37:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>We have no more sacred duty as parents, as neighbors and as a nation than the protection of our children. Despite our best efforts, too many children in Delaware, Missouri, and around the country still fall victim to abuse, often at the hands of adults they trusted. We need to do everything we can to pro...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/congress-must-stand-up-for-victims-of-child-abuse</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Congress must stand up for victims of child abuse and reauthorize Children's Advocacy Centers</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/congress-must-stand-up-for-victims-of-child-abuse-and-reauthorize-childrens-advocacy-centers</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Thu, 19 Jun 2014 12:40:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>The physical or sexual abuse of a child is an unconscionable crime. As parents, it is our worst nightmare &mdash; a fear that keeps us awake at night each time we hear the news of another predator apprehended in our communities. For children whose innocence has been shattered by violence and families who...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/congress-must-stand-up-for-victims-of-child-abuse-and-reauthorize-childrens-advocacy-centers</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>The Founding Fathers would have protected your smartphone</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/the-founding-fathers-would-have-protected-your-smartphone</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Wed, 28 May 2014 11:35:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Privacy is a core American value. For 235 years, the Fourth Amendment has protected us from unwarranted searches of our personal belongings. All the while, technology has been changing where and how we keep those belongings. On April 29, the Supreme Court held oral arguments in two cases, Riley v. Cal...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/the-founding-fathers-would-have-protected-your-smartphone</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Solar and wind energy deserve same tax break as oil and gas</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/solar-and-wind-energy-deserve-same-tax-break-as-oil-and-gas</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Fri, 23 May 2014 11:12:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Members of Congress have said it over and over again: the United States needs an all-of-the-above strategy for our energy future. But what does that actually mean? An all-of-the-above approach should be more than just rhetoric. It should be about taking real steps to harness all of our energy resources a...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/solar-and-wind-energy-deserve-same-tax-break-as-oil-and-gas</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Farm bill is a victory for Delaware</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/farm-bill-is-a-victory-for-delaware</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Tue, 11 Feb 2014 10:01:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Our region is home to some of America&rsquo;s finest poultry, produce, and grain crops. Delaware&rsquo;s vibrant agricultural industry supports 30,000 jobs and contributes $8 billion each year to our economy. That&rsquo;s why Congress&rsquo; reauthorization of the farm bill has been one of my highest priorities...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/farm-bill-is-a-victory-for-delaware</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Nelson Mandela and the power of forgiveness</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/nelson-mandela-and-the-power-of-forgiveness</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Tue, 17 Dec 2013 10:48:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>   As the world prepares to say its final goodbyes to Nelson Mandela today, the days since his passing have proved his life touched countless souls. His grace, compassion and ability to unite a co...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/nelson-mandela-and-the-power-of-forgiveness</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Outdated Laws Preserve HIV Stigma</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/outdated-laws-preserve-hiv-stigma</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 11:53:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Our nation and our science have come a long way since HIV/AIDS began mysteriously claiming lives in the United States. Unfortunately, many of our laws haven't kept up. Thirty-two states have criminal statutes based on perceived exposure to HIV -- regardless of the actual risk of transmission -- and 13 st...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/outdated-laws-preserve-hiv-stigma</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Time for Washington to refocus on manufacturing</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/time-for-washington-to-refocus-on-manufacturing</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Mon, 28 Oct 2013 11:06:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>   Delawareans are frustrated with the gridlock in Congress and its lack of focus&nbsp;on helping the private sector create good jobs. Washington&rsquo;s behavior is a far cry from the Delaware Way, but as d...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/time-for-washington-to-refocus-on-manufacturing</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Washington Needs to Refocus on Manufacturing Jobs</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/washington-needs-to-refocus-on-manufacturing-jobs</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Mon, 28 Oct 2013 10:54:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Congress hasn&rsquo;t given Americans much reason this year to believe it can work together in the country&rsquo;s best interest to help create jobs. That needs to change. It&rsquo;s time for Washington to refocus on manufacturing jobs instead of manufactured crises. The United States is primed f...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/washington-needs-to-refocus-on-manufacturing-jobs</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Surveillance debate echoes Founders' struggle</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/surveillance-debate-echoes-founders-struggle</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Wed, 18 Sep 2013 12:29:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>While the words of the Bill of Rights have not changed in the more than 200 years since their ratification, their meaning, their relevance and their impact have changed significantly. Like the soaring rhetoric of the Preamble and the Declaration of Independence before it, it took many years for the simpl...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/surveillance-debate-echoes-founders-struggle</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Washington must put focus back on jobs</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/washington-must-put-focus-back-on-jobs</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Sun, 01 Sep 2013 12:58:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Visiting with businesses large and small, meeting with workers, and listening to folks at our job fairs these last few months, I&rsquo;ve heard one message loudly and clearly: Delawareans are frustrated with Washington and want to know when Congress is going to refocus its attention on jobs and our economy....</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/washington-must-put-focus-back-on-jobs</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>For Americans, freedom and safety are not either-or choice</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/for-americans-freedom-and-safety-are-not-either-or-choice</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Sun, 09 Jun 2013 11:30:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>News stories this week reporting on two alleged aspects of the U.S. government&rsquo;s extensive digital surveillance of American citizens have shined a light on intelligence-gathering practices that have not received the public scrutiny they deserve. These surveillance programs were permitted under judicial ord...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/for-americans-freedom-and-safety-are-not-either-or-choice</guid>   </item>                <item>    <title>Creating jobs in Delaware by embracing Africa's economic potential</title>                               <link>http://www.coons.senate.gov/newsroom/articles/article/creating-jobs-in-delaware-by-embracing-africas-economic-potential</link>                  <author>webmaster</author>    <pubDate>Thu, 11 Apr 2013 13:54:00 EST</pubDate>    <description>Creating jobs in Delaware means making sure our local businesses can sell their goods and services to more customers &ndash; no matter where in the world they live. In today&rsquo;s global economy, we can&rsquo;t ignore the fact that 95 percent of the world&rsquo;s consumers live beyond our borders. Many of them...</description>    <guid>newsroom/articles/article/creating-jobs-in-delaware-by-embracing-africas-economic-potential</guid>   </item>    </channel> </rss>
